clinical_study.brief_title: VA Video Connect in HIV Care
clinical_study.official_title: VA Video Connect to Improve Access to Multi-disciplinary Specialty Care

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to see how effective the addition of video to home telehealth services is in helping patients with HIV to remain in care, which is vital to management of their illness. The investigators also want to understand how to best put the video to home services into practice.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Veterans in the Infections Disease clinic at the Michael E. DeBakey Veterans Affairs Medical Center (MEDVAMC) will be randomly assigned to either an offer of VA Video Connect (VVC) delivered HIV care or to usual care for HIV. All treatment as usual options for HIV care will be available to all patients in both treatment arms, however only the Veterans in the VVC arm will be actively offered this VA-approved technology.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who completed at least 1 visit with a primary care or Infectious Diseases provider in each 6 months of the year at least 60 days apart.

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of scheduled HIV clinic appointments attended over the year
Number of completed visits for counseling, mental health, and social services during the year.
Percentage of Veterans with HIV on ART whose most recent viral load during the 12-month period was <200c/mL
Number of ART medication pills dispensed from pharmacy over the year divided by days in year.

other_outcome.description: 10-item screening tool to assess alcohol consumption, drinking behaviors and alcohol-related problems. Item responses range from 0-4. Scores range from 0-40. Higher scores indicate more harmful alcohol use.

Brief measure of depression symptoms consisting of 9 items rated from 0-3 (0 = not at all, 1 = several days, 2 = more than half the days, 3 = nearly every day). Scores range from 0 to 27. Higher scores indicate greater depression severity.
Measure of PTSD symptoms. 20 items rated from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely). Scores range from 0 to 80. Higher scores = higher symptom severity.

Brief screening tool that assesses cognitive functioning across 8 domains; attention and concentration, executive functions, memory, language, conceptual thinking, calculations and orientation. Scores range from 0-30. Higher scores indicate greater cognitive function.
Last recorded value in medical record during 12 month period
Last recorded value in 12 months period.

arm_group.description: Option to receive VA Video Connect (VVC) delivery of HIV care.
All HIV care available at MEDVAMC will be delivered as usual.

intervention.description: Telehealth treatment is delivered via VA-approved technology to a patient's computer or mobile device.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient in the Infectious Diseases clinic at Michael E. DeBakey VA Medical Center (MEDVAMC), Houston, TX, with HIV infection
- At least 18 years of age
- Able to speak English
- Able to consent to the use of VVC
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to use or consent to use VVC, due to either significant physical or mental disability
- Incarcerated (though MEDVAMC does not generally provide care for prisoners)
